abstract.text: The common behavior for displaying text-based data in a complication.

inlineContent.text: to create complications for watchOS 10 or later. For more information, see Migrating to WidgetKit.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

platforms.message: On watchOS 9.0 or later, use WidgetKit instead
platforms.name: watchOS

inlineContent.text: Typically, you don’t create instances of this class yourself. Instead, you create instances of an appropriate subclass, based on the type of text data you’re trying to create. However, you can use the
class method to create a compound text provider constructed from a format string and the data from other text providers.

abstract.text: Display app-specific data on the clock face.
A formatted string that conveys a date without any time information.
A formatted string that conveys the difference in time between the current date and a date that you specify.
A single line of text to display in your complication interface.
The common behavior for displaying text-based data in a complication.
A localized string that describes the text.
Creates an empty text provider.
Creates and returns a text provider built from the specified format string.
Creates a localizable text provider with a strings file key that resolves to a format string, and with text providers for the replacement arguments.
Creates a localizable simple text provider using the strings file key for the text.
Creates a localizable simple text provider using strings file keys for both the regular text and the shorter fallback text.
Creates an empty text provider.
Creates and returns a text provider built from the specified format string.
The tint color to use for text.
A formatted time range.
A formatted time value.
Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

inlineContent.text: to create complications for watchOS 10 or later. For more information, see Migrating to WidgetKit.
